website_summaries.verdict: Features aircraft-grade aluminum in the construction, so it will stand up to constant use well.
pros: Good price point for a simple design in a gripper plate tool that's easy to use
Can handle sheets or panels up to 3/4 inch in thickness
Can carry up to 200 pounds of weight securely
Made in the USA, so you can count on the quality of the materials used in the construction
cons: Some shipping control issues, as some users report receiving a version with plastic construction

customer_reviews.title: Plastic version, not the aluminum one in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Same issue others have reported, I received the cheap plastic one (the Gorilla Gripper "Advantage"), not the original aluminum one represented in the pictures. The plastic one ("glass-filled nylon polymer" according to the company) is the newer low cost version that you can buy for around $20, but I'm sure not everyone returns it after receiving something different than the $45 dollar version they paid for. Very deceitful practice.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie J. Misino

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.  If you aren't careful you can snap off a chunk of drywall
customer_reviews.text: I have the 3/4" version and moved 24 sheets of 5/8" 4x8 drywall, heavy at 70 pounds each. When lifting I could sometimes hear (and almost feel) a little stress within the drywall.. I worried about snapping off a chunk. In all honesty that didn't happen except when I forgot to check the movable gripper on the back side. Yes.. each time you must check the hinged gripper to be sure it didn't rotate the other way or you WILL break a sheet. I would give this product 5 stars if it: a) had a larger gripping area (this might not be a concern with lighter panels). and b) didn't have a part that can rotate unnoticeably out of position.
customer_reviews.author: electriccafe

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I took it with me to the local lumber yard to buy 5 sheets of 3/4" B/C plywood. I offered to lend it to the two fellows loading it into my vehicle but they declined. (One got a bad splinter in his hand). I unloaded when I got home and I did it in half the time it took for them to load it. Works like a charm. By the way, I'm 65 and they were in their twenties...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Casey

customer_reviews.title: A very impressive way to lift and carry sheet stock
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much more than picking up a few full and partial sheets of 3/4 birch cabinet ply and some 5 X 5 sheets of Baltic Birch ply with it just to see how well it works, but so far it is exceeding my expectations. It's amazing how well it grips the sheets. Using it on full sheets of Baltic Birch ply is a little more difficult for me because of the 5' sheet size. I'm a little too short to lift the sheet with the Gorilla Gripper and carry the sheet comfortably. I guess I need longer legs for this. I have no problem when using it on the standard 4' X 8' sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Charley

customer_reviews.title: Bent on first use
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years and it served me well, but I don't know what changed between then and now. I recently ordered another and even though it was the metal one, the handle bent while trying to lift a piece of 3/4" ply on first use. I'm out of the return window now, but it seems like there aren't quite built as well. I managed to hammer the arm back but I would be hesitant to suggest this product again as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not the right tool for drywall over 8'
customer_reviews.text: I'm a drywall contractor & thought this would be useful for maneuvering drywall around. This is a very quality tool but is not useful for drywall. Right out of the box I tried to lift a 12' sheet & it snapped about 16" off the edge. It worked on an 8' sheet like in the description but, I didn't purchase this for maneuvering 8 footers around so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: KS071

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as useful as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I'll begin by saying this tool is everything it's claimed to be. Very durable, high quality, functional, doesn't slip, etc. Couldn't be better. And I'm sure it's wonderful for plywood, but I was really hoping this would help prevent those broken edges on particle board. Problem is, particle board is so stinkin' heavy that to try to lift it with one arm, in the position that the gorilla gripper requires, is just impossible for me. So I can't give it 5 stars just because it just doesn't work for the thing I most need it for. The problem's not with the gripper, it's me being 60 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: The gorilla gripper isn’t for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to move drywall was really looking forward to using it, however it just didn’t work for me been in drywall since 1971 and believe me I’ve moved a lot of drywal. This gripper didn’t feel right after a half a dozen move of 1/2” drywall it actually slightly injured my wrist, I found it nowhere as easy or smooth as it appears in the video. For me I would give it the lowest rating, again that just my view after trying it, sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: joe t.

customer_reviews.title: They all agree it's a great product and it's come in handy several times
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for a contractor friend, hubby and my boss (who owns a construction company). They all agree it's a great product and it's come in handy several times. Works just as shown in the videos we saw. Makes transporting sheets of plywood a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: lalyman

customer_reviews.title: Saved me time and energy
customer_reviews.text: What a great little invention. Just drop it over the top of a piece of plywood then pick it up. A little challenging carrying up a flight of stairs but I found if I put it up closer to the front of the plywood so I'm picking up the front more then it's easier to get up stairs. I've been able to quickly and safely get plywood on the roof with the Gorilla Gripper as well as unload a truck full of plywood quickly and easily. If you don't own one, you should, it's a great tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Save your back - this really works!
customer_reviews.text: Highly Recommend. Boy, do I love this thing. You cannot image how easy it is to move 4x8 sheets of plywood around with this. I sheathed a 30x48' outbuilding with over 100 sheets of wood with a pair of these and my boys. Lift a sheet with one hand enabling you to use the other for balance or of to grab a rope. I have not tried on drywall but that is my next project - I'll update my thoughts after that. Again, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Almost makes moving sheet goods effortless
customer_reviews.text: This is literally one of those, “why didn’t I buy this sooner?” tools. No more breaking my back or pinching my fingers or crushing my toes while carrying 4x8 sheets of plywood. This thing works.
customer_reviews.author: Vustadumas

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't do my job without it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't pick up heavy panels by myself without this. I have now moved hundreds of panels now with this, and I will never give it up. One caution, when using it on crushable sheets, like drywall, don't seat it all the way down before you lift up and put pressure on the clamp. Raise it off the edge just a little bit so it doesn't crush it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an invaluable tool for anyone moving 3/4" ply by themselves. I use this nearly every day, moving plywood from the truck to storage to my 4th floor workshop. The grip pad is textured rubber, and will not mar nice veneers (something I wondered about before buying).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not for drywall?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to carry drywall. I may have been a little foolish, but the second sheet of drywall was broken by the gripper. Basically too much force broke through the part being gripped by the gripper. I'm sure this works amazingly for sheets of plywood or other harder substances.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Rapp

customer_reviews.title: this septuagenarian would like it even more
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Were I younger, this septuagenarian would like it even more. When wrist strength declines with age, it can be awkward. Nevertheless, I independently separately transferred three 3/4" 4'X8', 60.8#, and other thinner plywood sheets from big-box store cart to trailer with it. Broad-based footing is required. A 20' rope loop supporting both lower corners will be less stressful by avoiding wrist hyperextension necessary with the Gorilla Gripper. Excellent design!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I saw one of these on a you-tube video when a woodworker was lifting a piece of cabinet plywood up onto his table. I thought "I gotta get one of these!". It seemed a little pricey, but it's worth every penny! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: GoldenGaits

customer_reviews.title: the device is pretty good. The articulating arm of the plastic version ...
customer_reviews.text: First, they shipped me the cheaper plastic version of this rather than the metal one I ordered. Second, the device is pretty good. The articulating arm of the plastic version is a little weird to position to grab the sheets. Once it's on it works great though. It will pick up any panel material from 1/8" acrylic to 3/4" ply. Overall I'm glad I purchased it. It's saved my back loading plywood.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis Designs

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Gorilla Gripper is an EXCELLENT tool. I moved 22 sheets of 1/2 inch 4x8 drywall and a 5/8 inch sheet of 4x8 plywood from my garage down to my basement without issue. A heavy, sturdy tool that works as intended. I am also impressed with the packaging of the product. Quality all the way! I'm a middle aged man and I needed this. IMO the $40 cost in nothing compared to a trip to the ER.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: It makes easy work moving drywall or plywood sheets around
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my dad and he ended up buying a couple more for his work. It makes easy work moving drywall or plywood sheets around. So much nicer for your hands and makes lifting a lot easier too.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time yesterday, made moving plywood from the shed to the shop a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Slowpok22

customer_reviews.title: A must-have if you work with sheet goods!
customer_reviews.text: While it's always best to have a human helper to move sheet goods, this tool enables you to pull and lift them by yourself. I even take mine to the lumber store when I plan to get plywood. It's super easy to use and is a real arm and back saver. I wish I had bought one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Warren Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: received item was made from plastic, not aluminum as pictured, cannot use and have to return.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: PLYWOOD SOLOIST
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool, for the first time I found carrying heavy 5/8 BCX plywood by myself was not that hard after buying this tool, what a GOD SEND this tool is...... everybody that works with plywood need one of these in the toolbox
customer_reviews.author: RB-St Louis

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip, man!
customer_reviews.text: This works well for me in moving my 5/8" plywood panels around. Easy to attach and detach, and appears quite sturdily made This model will lift up to a 3/4 panel. Now if it just had anti-gravity technology...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Move plywood sheets easily.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I am 71 years old and cannot lift plywood sheets as in the old days. With this device I can at least move them from truck to my shop and around the shop. It does not solve the problem of getting the sheets up on my table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G.

customer_reviews.title: The speciality tool every handyman should have!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is one of the best tools for moving sheets of OSB I have ever come across! My wrists and arms used to ache for days after moving 100 sheets but with this little jewel it was much faster and my hands, wrists, and arms didn’t hurt afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Simkins

customer_reviews.title: works great carried 3/4" 4' x 8" ply wood and 3/4" ...
customer_reviews.text: works great carried 3/4" 4' x 8" ply wood and 3/4" 4' x 8" OSB 7/16 OSB 4' x 8" 1/2" 4' x 8"drywall sheets with it. only have one thinking of buying second one so some one can help carry too
customer_reviews.author: Rod Moneysmith

customer_reviews.title: The gorilla gripper
customer_reviews.text: It’s just not as useful as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Grips 4x8 sheets
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for Hardie Board sheets and plywood. Be careful to order the correct thickness carrier for what you will be using. This was 0-3/4" gripper.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice it worked great. The first time it slipped, I didn't follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I’m building a workshop all by myself and I needed to be able to bring in wall board without help. This was a good solution. I would caution to make sure you have the gripper really tight on the piece you’re moving as I had one slip out .
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mason

customer_reviews.title: About time for this tool.
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been? I'm 70 years old and have a woodshop and believe me when I say this is a great tool. I am not a weak man but after shoving a few sheets of oak and walnut around anyone will appreciate this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A back saver
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool. Makes moving plywood and drywall a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: John Deakin

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for what they do but my dad loved them
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Hallman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool invented
customer_reviews.text: My husband was/is really amazed how he could carry a sheet of sheetrock/plywood with ease...by himself! He would actually give the product 10 ++ etc. stars!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I bought one of these and liked it so well
customer_reviews.text: Gorilla Gripper 0 - 3/4'' Plywood Carrier I bought one of these and liked it so well, I got one for my son. Makes it much easier to handle sheets of plywood.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Did the job as expected
customer_reviews.text: Did the job as expected. Makes the job much easier
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple of uses the pad started coming off. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Aukes

customer_reviews.title: very useful
customer_reviews.text: Having limited flexibility makes it difficult to get a good grip on anything wider than 20 inches. This makes carrying 4'x8' sheets of wood or drywall much easier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grafford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really works well, even on full sheets of 3/4” plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wayyyyy useful
customer_reviews.text: Totally saves your hands/back. Shudda bought one long, long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Neal W.

customer_reviews.title: Great device, Got one for several contractor/DIY friends
customer_reviews.text: Great device, Got one for several contractor/DIY friends. They were very impressed with the way it worked.
customer_reviews.author: lalyman

customer_reviews.title: Moving plywood has never been easier
customer_reviews.text: This device is one of the best devices ever made. Moving plywood is a breeze. Can’t believe it took me this long to buy one. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Work solo?  You need this, brah!
customer_reviews.text: If you work solo and lift sheets of plywood with any frequency (or even just from time to time), you need this in your work life! This had made moving sheets around so much easier in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Tory J Lodmell

customer_reviews.title: Received the Gorilla Gripper Advantage not the Gorilla Gripper
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong Gorilla Gripper. I sent the advantage which is cheaper. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: verth20

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I can haul in 1" thick 8'x4' plywood all by myself.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Turner

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Grips very well and will frankly hold more weight than I care to lift with one arm. Quality build. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great work Saver
customer_reviews.text: Really makes handling 4 X 8 sheets by myself a breeze. I take it to the store with me to load sheet goods.
customer_reviews.author: Dovey739

customer_reviews.title: a well made product
customer_reviews.text: You can tell this is a well made product. I would definitely buy one again however I don't suspect I will ever have to.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Emerick

customer_reviews.title: This works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I can now move my 4ft x 9ft sheets of 5/8" wood siding by myself very easily. Makes handling so much easier and you don't have to get under the sheets to lift them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't use on 12' - 5/8" drywall
customer_reviews.text: It broke a chunk out in the middle of the 12' board that i already had piece cut out for the window. BUT it did fine as i moved the 10' and 8' boards. so a 12' just became scarp :(
customer_reviews.author: Kim A. Owen-Parker

customer_reviews.title: Received Gorilla Gripper "Advantage", but it's a cheaper model ($29.95) than one that is pictured. Not cool.
customer_reviews.text: I received the "Gorilla Gripper Advantage" model which has plastic grips, not the Aluminum model that is shown in the photo with the company logo. The "Advantage" model has an MSRP on the manufacturer's web site of $29.95 likely because it's largely plastic. To show the $49.95 model priced at $42 and then send the $29.95 model is pretty crooked. This one is probably fine and may be better because it's probably lighter than the other one, but I'm sending it back because getting a different product than what is pictured is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Harley L.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't hold if plywood is tipped to go down stairs. Had to repair end of steps.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my friend. I got this model ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my friend. I got this model so he could carry drywall or plywood. He loves it, and he is a picky consumer.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wrapping gifts tonight and found that a used one was enclosed in the box...

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Makes carrying 4x8 sheets of plywood/OSB by yourself a lot easier.

customer_reviews.title: Not a
customer_reviews.text: This item was not as pictured; it is a cheap China knock-off. Returned for refund.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, really makes handling 4' x 8' sheets ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, really makes handling 4' x 8' sheets off 3/4 paneling a lot easier. I've got the carriers that you use by putting the sheet on the bottom, but this carrier really makes things easier.
customer_reviews.author: jdcmontana

customer_reviews.title: A great help for an old guy with chronic lower back ...
customer_reviews.text: A great help for an old guy with chronic lower back problems. I find the grip from the top of the sheet to be much easier for me.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool if you work alone
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. Will be a helper for life.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I use the Gorilla to move 3/4" x 4' x 8' sheets of Furniture Grade Plywood with no problems. Love It.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband and ladies let's face it, it isn't easy to find something for a man that has everything. He LOVES it and used it the same day.

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on half and three quarter plywood. Makes it much easier to lift and carry especially going through door ways.

customer_reviews.text: I've had two now & still don't have one. Both my father & son liked it so much I gave it to them. The next one I'm keeping!

customer_reviews.text: Made moving full sheets of 1/2” plywood down 40 stairs a breeze!

customer_reviews.text: I was not able to lift the way the demo showed but I still used it in other ways.

customer_reviews.text: I have back problems and this item helps to keep my back from going into spasms when lifting heavy sheets of plywood.

customer_reviews.title: I'm now the HULK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works, has the strength of a Gorilla's hand, damn strong gripper, EZ on, EZ off. Well designed, well made, sturdy. No need to overload your spine trying to carry heavy sheet goods anymore. This is a worthwhile purchase for anyone who has to handle sheet goods, strongly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: My crew snatched it out of my hands and put ...
customer_reviews.text: My crew snatched it out of my hands and put it right to work! They wanted to know what took me so long to find it.

customer_reviews.title: Great unique tool
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get it soon enough to use it to haul 55 sheets of 1/2" plywood up a flight of 21 steps (my fault) but I had it to work with 4x12x5/8 drywall in a tight hallway. It was perfect. I am very glad to have it. I can't wait to carry 3/4 T&G subfloor in the wind with it. I am usually flown all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: gpripps

customer_reviews.title: Super product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Quality construction out of heavy duty materials. A real back saver!

customer_reviews.text: The Gorilla Gripper is an excellent tool. Don't know how I got along without it. It might be a little pricy BUT it is made in the USA (what's left of it).

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my husband for Christmas. We are doing work in our basement and he says this tool is a life saver!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far

customer_reviews.title: Can handle a 3/4" sheet of ply wood.
customer_reviews.text: Gorilla gripper works great it's construction is heavy duty and a great help in my one man shop.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Ridgwell

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiness of the carrier. I bought it to make it easier to carry thirty sheets of drywall upstairs. I haven't started that project, so not sure on how it will work. I'm concerned that I will dent or break the drywall, but I will find out when I try. It works great for plywood. It much easier to carry. I have a different panel carrier, but it is not as easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: makes handling 4x8 sheets of plywood or drywall easy for one person to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Threatt

customer_reviews.title: Helper
customer_reviews.text: The Gorilla Gripper does what it claims to do.It is very handy when moving,hard to carry, large pieces of plywood or particle board around.Would recommend it for anyone that builds or remodels.Very glad I got it and at Amazon's great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect helper for handling sheet goods.
customer_reviews.text: just don't know why I put off buying this as long as I did. Needed some help to carry 8 sheets of plywd. from my garage to my basement workshop. this was the perfect tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: R Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Not so gripper ?
customer_reviews.text: Has a tendency to slip off, with 3/4 ply to heavy for one hand lift for me . Maybe if it had a locking mech. Kinda think was 50$ not well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Coons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the one person shop
customer_reviews.text: Handling 8x4 sheets of 3/4 inch plywood by myself at times has been difficult. Two or three sheets is not bad, but ten or twenty start to put a strain on the back and shoulders. I saw this a few times online and had a large order coming up. It as a perfect fit. Easy to use and easy to handle sheets of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Ten Acre Woods LLC

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: Great. So handy. Should have bought this a long time ago. Saves my back and makes carrying pieces of plywood possible. Two of them would be even better for two people to carry large pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Arie

product_meta.title: Gorilla Gripper 'GP' 0 to 3/4" (0 to 22mm)
product_meta.description: Gripping hand tool designed for lifting, carrying and moving a variety of building materials that are large, unwieldy and heavy…panels of plywood, particle board, drywall/wallboard, melamine, sheet metal, solid core doors, table tops, solid surface materials, granite, marble and more…all with surprising ease! The unique Gorilla Gripper grips from the top, making it easy to position, providing wonderful leverage, permitting a full field of vision while carrying, and encouraging proper lifting technique. It has a soft-cushioned handle that serves as a lever, using the weight of the panel to create clamping force. With non-marring rubberized gripping pads the gripping plates pivot to remain parallel, self-adjusting to the thickness of the material. An excellent solution for anyone having to move sheet goods, whether every day or once a year! Considering the importance of a well-preserved back, the Gorilla Gripper is likely to be the best investment a construction worker, woodworker or DIY’er will ever make…and less expensive than one visit to a Chiropractor!
feature_bullets: Automatically clamps onto any stock from 0''-3/4''
Made in the USA from aircraft aluminum
